snippet: The city’s Department of Investigation cites mismanagement, overdependence on contractors and tampering with status reports in a new report on a halted project.
abstract: Investigation highlights failings of $2 billion upgrade of New York City's 911 emergency system, which was canceled by Mayor Bill de Blasio due to mismanagement; study finds that upgrade was plagued by over-billing and poor oversight, and that city employees were pressured to downplay its problems.
lead_paragraph: The city’s Department of Investigation cites mismanagement, overdependence on contractors and tampering with status reports in a new report on a halted project.

headline.main: Investigation Finds Problems With Work on New York City 911 System
headline.print_headline: Investigation of Problems With Work on 911 System
